trans-unit.source: Overview of schemas and the Enterprise Integration Pack | Microsoft Azure App Service | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Overview of schemas and the Enterprise Integration Pack | Microsoft Azure App Service | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use schemas with the Enterprise Integration Pack and Logic apps
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use schemas with the Enterprise Integration Pack and Logic apps

trans-unit.source: Learn about schemas and the Enterprise Integration Pack
trans-unit.target: Learn about schemas and the Enterprise Integration Pack

trans-unit.source: Why use a schema
trans-unit.target: Why use a schema

trans-unit.source: You use schemas to confirm that XML documents you receive are valid, meaning that the documents contain the expected data in a predefined format.
trans-unit.target: You use schemas to confirm that XML documents you receive are valid, meaning that the documents contain the expected data in a predefined format.

trans-unit.source: How to add a schema
trans-unit.target: How to add a schema

trans-unit.source: From the Azure portal:
trans-unit.target: From the Azure portal:

trans-unit.source: Select **More Services**
trans-unit.target: Select **More Services**

trans-unit.source: Enter **integration** in the filter search box and select **Integration Accounts** from the results list
trans-unit.target: Enter **integration** in the filter search box and select **Integration Accounts** from the results list

trans-unit.source: Select the **integration account** to which you add the schema
trans-unit.target: Select the **integration account** to which you add the schema

trans-unit.source: Select the **Schemas** tile
trans-unit.target: Select the **Schemas** tile

trans-unit.source: To add schema file less than 2 MB
trans-unit.target: To add schema file less than 2 MB

trans-unit.source: Select the **Add** button in the Schemas blade that opens
trans-unit.target: Select the **Add** button in the Schemas blade that opens

trans-unit.source: Enter a **Name** for your schema, then to upload the schema file, select the folder icon on the right side of the **Schema** text box.
trans-unit.target: Enter a **Name** for your schema, then to upload the schema file, select the folder icon on the right side of the **Schema** text box.

trans-unit.source: After the upload process is completed, select the **OK** button.
trans-unit.target: After the upload process is completed, select the **OK** button.

trans-unit.source: To add schema file larger than 2 MB (Max 8 MB)
trans-unit.target: To add schema file larger than 2 MB (Max 8 MB)

trans-unit.source: If blob security access level is **Public**
trans-unit.target: If blob security access level is **Public**

trans-unit.source: Upload the schema to storage and copy the URI
trans-unit.target: Upload the schema to storage and copy the URI

trans-unit.source: Select Large file in Add Schema and provide the URI in the Content URI
trans-unit.target: Select Large file in Add Schema and provide the URI in the Content URI

trans-unit.source: If blob security access level is **No anonymous access**
trans-unit.target: If blob security access level is **No anonymous access**

trans-unit.source: Upload the schema to storage
trans-unit.target: Upload the schema to storage

trans-unit.source: Generate a Shared Access Signature for the schema
trans-unit.target: Generate a Shared Access Signature for the schema

trans-unit.source: Select Large file in Add Schema and provide the Shared Access Signature URI in the Content URI
trans-unit.target: Select Large file in Add Schema and provide the Shared Access Signature URI in the Content URI

trans-unit.source: You should see the newly added schema
trans-unit.target: You should see the newly added schema

trans-unit.source: How to use schemas
trans-unit.target: How to use schemas

trans-unit.source: Schemas are used to validate messages that are exchanged in a B2B scenario.
trans-unit.target: Schemas are used to validate messages that are exchanged in a B2B scenario.

trans-unit.source: How to edit schemas
trans-unit.target: How to edit schemas

trans-unit.source: Select the **Schemas** tile
trans-unit.target: Select the **Schemas** tile

trans-unit.source: Select the schema you wish to edit from the Schemas blade that opens up
trans-unit.target: Select the schema you wish to edit from the Schemas blade that opens up

trans-unit.source: Select the **Upload** link on the Schemas blade
trans-unit.target: Select the **Upload** link on the Schemas blade

trans-unit.source: Select the schema file you wish to upload by using the file picker dialog that opens up.
trans-unit.target: Select the schema file you wish to upload by using the file picker dialog that opens up.

trans-unit.source: Select **Open** in the file picker
trans-unit.target: Select **Open** in the file picker

trans-unit.source: You receive a notification that indicates the upload was successful
trans-unit.target: You receive a notification that indicates the upload was successful

trans-unit.source: How to delete schemas
trans-unit.target: How to delete schemas

trans-unit.source: Select the **Schemas** tile
trans-unit.target: Select the **Schemas** tile

trans-unit.source: Select the schema you wish to delete from the Schemas blade that opens up
trans-unit.target: Select the schema you wish to delete from the Schemas blade that opens up

trans-unit.source: Select the **Delete** link from the menu bar on the Schemas blade
trans-unit.target: Select the **Delete** link from the menu bar on the Schemas blade

trans-unit.source: If you really wish to delete the schema you selected, choose **Yes** on the Delete schema dialog to confirm your choice
trans-unit.target: If you really wish to delete the schema you selected, choose **Yes** on the Delete schema dialog to confirm your choice

trans-unit.source: Finally, notice that the list of schemas in the Schemas blade refreshes and the schema you deleted is no longer listed
trans-unit.target: Finally, notice that the list of schemas in the Schemas blade refreshes and the schema you deleted is no longer listed

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps
